KIN101A.name: Swimming I
KIN101A.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KIN101A.description: Beginning swimming. Development of skills in water readiness activities, floating, back and prone glide, sculling, freestyle, backstroke, and elementary backstroke. Demonstrate knowledge of propulsion and resistance forces, correct stroke technique, and safety and emergency procedures.
KIN101A.restrictions: A student may earn a maximum of 8 credits in all enrollments for this course if different activities or the same activities at higher levels are involved. Students are limited to a combined total of 8 credits in KIN 101-108 and KIN 111-118.

KIN101M.name: Great Lakes Sailing
KIN101M.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KIN101M.restrictions: A student may earn a maximum of 8 credits in all enrollments for this course if different activities or the same activities at higher levels are involved. Students are limited to a combined total of 8 credits in KIN 101-108 and KIN 111-118.

KIN101N.name: Intro to Stand-up Paddleboarding, Kayaking & Canoeing
KIN101N.semester: Fall of every year, Summer of every year
KIN101N.description: Learning to kayak, stand-up paddleboard and canoe.
KIN101N.restrictions: A student may earn a maximum of 8 credits in all enrollments for this course if different activities or the same activities at higher levels are involved. Students are limited to a combined total of 8 credits in KIN 101-108 and KIN 111-118.

KIN101T.name: SCUBA Diving I
KIN101T.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KIN101T.description: Beginning scuba. Pool and classroom portion of open water certification.
KIN101T.restrictions: A student may earn a maximum of 8 credits in all enrollments for this course if different activities or the same activities at higher levels are involved. Students are limited to a combined total of 8 credits in KIN 101-108 and KIN 111-118.

KIN101U.name: Sailing
KIN101U.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KIN101U.description: Beginning-level hands-on learn to sail program.
KIN101U.restrictions: A student may earn a maximum of 8 credits in all enrollments for this course if different activities or the same activities at higher levels are involved. Students are limited to a combined total of 8 credits in KIN 101-108 and KIN 111-118.

KIN102A.name: Judo I
KIN102A.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KIN102A.description: Introduction to the sport of Judo. Learn and perform basic skills including falling, throwing, hold-down, and submission hold. Competition rules of Judo.
KIN102A.restrictions: A student may earn a maximum of 8 credits in all enrollments for this course if different activities or the same activities at higher levels are involved. Students are limited to a combined total 8 credits in KIN 101-108 and KIN 111-118.

KIN102C.name: Karate I
KIN102C.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KIN102C.description: Introduction to the sport of Karate. Learn and perform the basic skills of kick, strike, block, stance and footwork. Self defense, one-step and sparring techniques.
KIN102C.restrictions: A student may earn a maximum of 8 credits in all enrollments for this course if different activities or the same activities at higher levels are involved. Students are limited to a combined total of 8 credits in KIN 101-108 and KIN 111-118.

KIN102K.name: Tae Kwon Do I
KIN102K.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KIN102K.description: Explore skill and knowledge development in the art of Taekwondo.
KIN102K.restrictions: A student may earn a maximum of 8 credits in all enrollments for this course if different activities or the same activities at higher levels are involved. Students are limited to a combined total of 8 credits in KIN 101-108 and KIN 111-118.

KIN102M.name: Introduction to Kendo
KIN102M.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KIN102M.description: Basic movements, history, philosophy, and concepts of the martial art of kendo. Learning kendo through its practice.
KIN102M.restrictions: A student may earn a maximum of 8 credits in all enrollments for this course if different activities or the same activities at higher levels are involved. Students are limited to a combined total of 8 credits in KIN 101-108 and KIN 111-118.

KIN102N.name: Introduction to Wing Chun
KIN102N.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KIN102N.description: Learning to balance, focus, and self-defense techniques of Wing Chun.
KIN102N.restrictions: A student may earn a maximum of 8 credits in all enrollments for this course if different activities or the same activities at higher levels are involved. Students are limited to a combined total of 8 credits in KIN 101-108 and KIN 111-118.

KIN103A.name: Aerobic Exercise I
KIN103A.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KIN103A.description: Beginner and intermediate aerobics. Introduction to theoretical and practical principles of stretching, toning, and aerobic activity that progressively improve cardiovascular strength and endurance, flexibility, coordination and body image.
KIN103A.restrictions: A student may earn a maximum of 8 credits in all enrollments for this course if different activities or the same activities at higher levels are involved. Students are limited to a combined total of 8 credits in KIN 101-108 and KIN 111-118.

KIN103C.name: Aerobic Exercise, Low Impact
KIN103C.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KIN103C.description: Introduction to theoretical and practical principles of stretching, toning, and low impact aerobic activity that progressively improve cardiovascular strength and endurance, flexibility, coordination and body image.
KIN103C.restrictions: A student may earn a maximum of 8 credits in all enrollments for this course if different activities or the same activities at higher levels are involved. Students are limited to a combined total of 8 credits in KIN 101-108 and KIN 111-118.

KIN103D.name: General Conditioning I
KIN103D.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KIN103D.description: Physical fitness, exercise, and health principles and practices applied to personal exercise and health programs through activities such as target heart rate monitoring, body measurements, posture analysis, and energy intake and expenditure assessments. Demonstrations and vigorous exercise activities.
KIN103D.restrictions: A student may earn a maximum of 8 credits in all enrollments for this course if different activities or the same activities at higher levels are involved. Students are limited to a combined total of 8 credits in KIN 101-108 and KIN 111-118.

KIN103G.name: Power Walking
KIN103G.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KIN103G.description: Basic knowledge of physical fitness and healthy lifestyle principles. Muscular strength and endurance, flexibility, cardiovascular endurance, and total body health.
KIN103G.restrictions: A student may earn a maximum of 8 credits in all enrollments for this course if different activities or the same activities at higher levels are involved. Students are limited to a combined total of 8 credits in KIN 101-108 and KIN 111-118.

KIN103R.name: Weight Training I
KIN103R.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KIN103R.description: Basic level weight training principles, basic anatomy, and diet and nutrition. Enhance muscular strength, endurance and flexibility.
KIN103R.restrictions: A student may earn a maximum of 8 credits in all enrollments for this course if different activities or the same activities at higher levels are involved. Students are limited to a combined total of 8 credits in KIN 101-108 and KIN 111-118.

KIN103S.name: Swim Conditioning
KIN103S.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KIN103S.description: Cardiovascular fitness through swimming. Muscular endurance, strength and flexibility, and cardiovascular fitness. Training principles and techniques such as interval training, long distance swimming and dry land exercises. Basic nutrition and diet guidelines.
KIN103S.restrictions: A student may earn a maximum of 8 credits in all enrollments for this course if different activities or the same activities at higher levels are involved. Students are limited to a combined total of 8 credits in KIN 101-108 and KIN 111-118.

KIN103T.name: Distance Running
KIN103T.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KIN103T.description: Basic understanding of distance running as a form of developing cardiovascular endurance and muscular strength and endurance for recreation and competition. Goal setting, designing workouts, injury awareness and prevention, training in adverse weather and environmental conditions and proper nutritional guidelines.
KIN103T.restrictions: A student may earn a maximum of 8 credits in all enrollments for this course if different activities or the same activities at higher levels are involved. Students are limited to a combined total of 8 credits in KIN 101-108 and KIN 111-118.

KIN103U.name: Step Aerobics
KIN103U.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KIN103U.description: An alternative to high impact aerobics for beginning and intermediate step students. Introduction to theoretical and practical principles of stretching, toning, and step aerobic activity that progressively improve cardiovascular strength and endurance, flexibility, coordination and body image.
KIN103U.restrictions: A student may earn a maximum of 8 credits in all enrollments for this course if different activities or the same activities at higher levels are involved. Students are limited to a combined total of 8 credits in KIN 101-108 and KIN 111-118.

KIN103V.name: Boxing Conditioning
KIN103V.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KIN103V.description: Introduction to boxing specific conditioning. Fundamentals and techniques.
KIN103V.restrictions: A student may earn a maximum of 8 credits in all enrollments for this course if different activities or the same activities at higher levels are involved. Students are limited to a combined total of 8 credits in KIN 101-108 and KIN 111-118.

KIN106C.name: Bowling I
KIN106C.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KIN106C.description: Fundamental skills of bowling including form and technique. Terminology, rules, strategies and scoring procedures.
KIN106C.restrictions: A student may earn a maximum of 8 credits in all enrollments for this course if different activities or the same activities at higher levels are involved. Students are limited to a combined total of 8 credits in KIN 101-108 and KIN 111-118.

KIN106E.name: Golf I
KIN106E.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KIN106E.description: Beginning golf. Rules and etiquette of the game, basic swing fundamentals, and proper equipment selection.
KIN106E.restrictions: A student may earn a maximum of 8 credits in all enrollments for this course if different activities or the same activities at higher levels are involved. Students are limited to a combined total of 8 credits in KIN 101-108 and KIN 111-118.

KIN106G.name: Horsemanship I
KIN106G.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KIN106G.restrictions: A student may earn a maximum of 8 credits in all enrollments for this course if different activities or the same activities at higher levels are involved. Students are limited to a combined total of 8 credits in KIN 101-108 and KIN 111-118.

KIN106S.name: Archery
KIN106S.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KIN106S.description: Beginning and intermediate level hands-on learning of archery.
KIN106S.restrictions: A student may earn a maximum of 8 credits in all enrollments for this course if different activities or the same activities at higher levels are involved. Students are limited to a combined total of 8 credits in KIN 101-108 and KIN 111-118.

KIN106V.name: Self Defense
KIN106V.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KIN106V.description: Increase awareness and understanding of sexual assault. Focus on defense against sexual violence. Techniques for diffusing and avoiding potentially dangerous situations. Physical self-defense skills.
KIN106V.restrictions: A student may earn a maximum of 8 credits in all enrollments for this course if different activities or the same activities at higher levels are involved. Students are limited to a combined total of 8 credits in KIN 101-108 and KIN 111-118.

KIN106W.name: Yoga
KIN106W.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KIN106W.description: Explore the beginning aspects of Yoga.
KIN106W.restrictions: A student may earn a maximum of 8 credits in all enrollments for this course if different activities or the same activities at higher levels are involved. Students are limited to a combined total of 8 credits in KIN 101-108 and KIN 111-118.

KIN107B.name: Racquetball I
KIN107B.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KIN107B.description: Fundamental skills of racquetball including forehand, backhand, and serve. Basic rules, strategies, and scoring.
KIN107B.restrictions: A student may earn a maximum of 8 credits in all enrollments for this course if different activities or the same activities at higher levels are involved. Students are limited to a combined total of 8 credits in KIN 101-108 and KIN 111-118.

KIN107E.name: Tennis I
KIN107E.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KIN107E.description: Introduction to the basic strokes, footwork, and court positions to play singles and doubles tennis. Rules, scoring and game etiquette.
KIN107E.restrictions: A student may earn a maximum of 8 credits in all enrollments for this course if different activities or the same activities at higher levels are involved. Students are limited to a combined total of 8 credits in KIN 101-108 and KIN 111-118.

KIN107G.name: Handball
KIN107G.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
KIN107G.description: Introduction to handball, including safety awareness, proper technique and etiquette, team and individual play for life-long form of exercise.
KIN107G.restrictions: A student may earn a maximum of 8 credits in all enrollments for this course if different activities or the same activities at higher levels are involved. Students are limited to a combined total of 8

KIN108A.name: Basketball I
KIN108A.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KIN108A.description: Skill drills, half court scrimmages, and full court games to improve basic skills, game play, and endurance. Basic skills, rules, and basic defensive and offensive strategies.
KIN108A.restrictions: A student may earn a maximum of 8 credits in all enrollments for this course if different activities or the same activities at higher levels are involved. Students are limited to a combined total of 8 credits in KIN 101-108 and KIN 111-118.

KIN108C.name: Ice Hockey I
KIN108C.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KIN108C.description: Elementary hockey concepts, skills and strategies.
KIN108C.restrictions: A student may earn a maximum of 8 credits in all enrollments for this course if different activities or the same activities at higher levels are involved. Students are limited to a combined total of 8 credits in KIN 101-108 and KIN 111-118.

KIN108F.name: Soccer I
KIN108F.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KIN108F.description: Fundamental skills and tactics of outdoor soccer. Rules, scoring, and offensive and defensive strategies will be emphasized.
KIN108F.restrictions: A student may earn a maximum of 8 credits in all enrollments for this course if different activities or the same activities at higher levels are involved. Students are limited to a combined total of 8 credits in KIN 101-108 and KIN 111-118.

KIN108K.name: Volleyball I
KIN108K.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KIN108K.description: Fundamental skills, rules and strategies of volleyball. Drills and game play.
KIN108K.restrictions: A student may earn a maximum of 8 credits in all enrollments for this course if different activities or the same activities at higher levels are involved. Students are limited to a combined total of 8 credits in KIN 101-108 and KIN 111-118.

KIN108P.name: Softball I
KIN108P.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KIN108P.description: Basic skills of throwing, fielding, hitting, and base running. Rules, offensive and defensive strategies, and scorekeeping.
KIN108P.restrictions: A student may earn a maximum of 8 credits in all enrollments for this course if different activities or the same activities at higher levels are involved. Students are limited to a combined total of 8 credits in KIN 101-108 and KIN 111-118.

KIN108R.name: Soccer, Indoor
KIN108R.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KIN108R.description: Basic technical and tactical soccer skills specific to the indoor soccer arena. Drills and game play.
KIN108R.restrictions: A student may earn a maximum of 8 credits in all enrollments for this course if different activities or the same activities at higher levels are involved. Students are limited to a combined total of 8 credits in KIN 101-108 and KIN 111-118.

KIN108W.name: Wheelchair Sports
KIN108W.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
KIN108W.description: Fundamental wheelchair sport skills. Team offensive and defensive concepts and strategies in a variety of wheelchair-based sports.
KIN108W.restrictions: A student may earn a maximum of 8 credits in all enrollments for this course if different activities or the same activities at higher levels are involved. Students are limited to a combined total of 8 credits in KIN 101-108 and KIN 111-118.

KIN109.name: Specialized Sports and Physical Activities
KIN109.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KIN109.description: Specialized opportunities in sports and physical activities. Competence in special skills, rules, and cultural perspectives as related to various offered activities.
KIN109.restrictions: A student may earn a maximum of 8 credits in all enrollments for this course if different activities or the same activities at higher levels are involved. Students are limited to a combined total of 8 credits in KIN 101-108 and KIN 111-118.

KIN111A.name: Swimming II
KIN111A.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KIN111A.description: Intermediate swimming to refine swimming skills, learn new strokes, increase swimming fitness levels, and learn basic water safety and rescue techniques. Stroke and skill emphasis will be placed on sculling, freestyle, backstroke, breaststroke, elementary backstroke, diving, and flip turns. Demonstration of knowledge of propulsion and resistance forces, correct stroke technique, and safety and emergency procedures.
KIN111A.restrictions: A student may earn a maximum of 8 credits in all enrollments for this course if different activities or the same activities at higher levels are involved. Students are limited to a combined total of 8 credits in KIN 101-108 and KIN 111-118.

KIN111B.name: Swimming III
KIN111B.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KIN111B.description: Advanced swimming to refine swimming skills, learn new strokes, increase swimming fitness levels, and learn basic water safety and rescue techniques. Develop and refine skills in sculling, freestyle, backstroke, breaststroke, butterfly, and sidestroke, as well as dives and turns. Demonstration of knowledge of propulsion and resistance forces, correct stoke technique and safety and emergency procedures.
KIN111B.restrictions: A student may earn a maximum of 8 credits in all enrollments for this course if different activities or the same activities at higher levels are involved. Students are limited to a combined total of 8 credits in KIN 101-108 and KIN 111-118.

KIN111G.name: SCUBA Diving II
KIN111G.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KIN111G.restrictions: A student may earn a maximum of 8 credits in all enrollments for this course if different activities or the same activities at higher levels are involved. Students are limited to a combined total of 8 credits in KIN 101-108 and KIN 111-118.

KIN112A.name: Judo II
KIN112A.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KIN112A.description: Advanced judo sport skills that involve actual contest, Rondori, and contest strategies will be emphasized in order to assist the students in attaining a higher level of proficiency in Judo.
KIN112A.restrictions: A student may earn a maximum of 8 credits in all enrollments for this course if different activities or the same activities at higher levels are involved. Students are limited to a combined total of 8 credits in KIN 101-108 and KIN 111-118.

KIN112B.name: Karate II
KIN112B.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KIN112B.description: Advanced karate skills that involve actual contest and contest strategies will be emphasized in order to assist the students in attaining a higher level of proficiency in Karate.
KIN112B.restrictions: A student may earn a maximum of 8 credits in all enrollments for this course if different activities or the same activities at higher levels are involved. Students are limited to a combined total of 8 credits in KIN 101-108 and KIN 111-118.

KIN113A.name: Aerobic Exercise II
KIN113A.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KIN113A.description: Intermediate and advanced aerobics. Introduction to theoretical and practical principles of stretching, toning, and aerobic activity that progressively improve cardiovascular strength and endurance, flexibility, coordination and body image.
KIN113A.restrictions: A student may earn a maximum of 8 credits in all enrollments for this course if different activities or the same activities at higher levels are involved. Students are limited to a combined total of 8 credits in KIN 101-108 and KIN 111-118.

KIN113B.name: General Conditioning II
KIN113B.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KIN113B.description: Improve cardiovascular endurance, body strength, flexibility, agility, balance, and rhythm through aerobic exercises, flexibility and resistance training programs. Extensive information on physical fitness, exercise, and health principles and practices.
KIN113B.restrictions: A student may earn a maximum of 8 credits in all enrollments for this course if different activities or the same activities at higher levels are involved. Students are limited to a combined total of 8 credits in KIN 101-108 and KIN 111-118.

KIN113C.name: General Conditioning III
KIN113C.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KIN113C.description: Basic principles of advanced aerobic and strength training programs. Application of knowledge in the form of an individualized exercise program. Competitive training techniques for both an aerobic and strength program.
KIN113C.restrictions: A student may earn a maximum of 8 credits in all enrollments for this course if different activities or the same activities at higher levels are involved. Students are limited to a combined total of 8 credits in KIN 101-108 and KIN 111-118.

KIN113E.name: Weight Training II
KIN113E.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KIN113E.description: Intermediate level weight training principles, basic anatomy and muscle physiology, and nutrition and diet. Weight training programs and development of personal training programs.
KIN113E.restrictions: A student may earn a maximum of 8 credits in all enrollments for this course if different activities or the same activities at higher levels are involved. Students are limited to a combined total of 8 credits in KIN 101-108 and KIN 111-118.

KIN113F.name: Weight Training III
KIN113F.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KIN113F.description: Advanced weight training techniques, principles, and programs. Strength training principles, anatomy and muscle physiology, nutrition and diet. Development of a personalized weight training program that incorporates the principles and guidelines.
KIN113F.restrictions: A student may earn a maximum of 8 credits in all enrollments for this course if different activities or the same activities at higher levels are involved. Students are limited to a combined total of 8 credits in KIN 101-108 and KIN 111-118.

KIN113N.name: General Conditioning IV
KIN113N.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KIN113N.description: Vigorous cardiovascular program that emphasizes advanced aerobic endurance. Aerobic training principles, muscle and cardiovascular physiologies, nutrition and diet. Personalized aerobic training program.
KIN113N.restrictions: A student may earn a maximum of 8 credits in all enrollments for this course if different activities or the same activities at higher levels are involved. Students are limited to a combined total of 8 credits in KIN 101-108 and KIN 111-118.

KIN113P.name: Weight Training IV
KIN113P.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KIN113P.description: Advanced weight training. Strength training principles, anatomy and muscle physiology, nutrition and diet. Personalized weight training program.
KIN113P.restrictions: A student may earn a maximum of 8 credits in all enrollments for this course if different activities or the same activities at higher levels are involved. Students are limited to a combined total of 8 credits in KIN 101-108 and KIN 111-118.

KIN113V.name: Boxing Conditioning II
KIN113V.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KIN113V.description: Intense boxing specific conditioning. Fundamentals and techniques.
KIN113V.restrictions: Students are limited to a combined total of 8 credits in KIN 101-108 and KIN 111-118.

KIN113W.name: Boxing Conditioning III
KIN113W.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KIN113W.description: Advanced boxing specific conditioning and techniques.
KIN113W.restrictions: Students are limited to a combined total of 8 credits in KIN 101-108 and KIN 111-118.

KIN116A.name: Bowling II
KIN116A.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KIN116A.description: Refine and improve basic bowling skills, while developing technique, form and strategies. Bowling rules and etiquette, spare targeting and conversions, spot or pin bowling and league playing.
KIN116A.restrictions: A student may earn a maximum of 8 credits in all enrollments for this course if different activities or the same activities at higher levels are involved. Students are limited to a combined total of 8 credits in KIN 101-108 and KIN 111-118.

KIN116B.name: Golf II
KIN116B.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KIN116B.description: Refine and further develop golf skills to improve ones game and performance. Methods of improvement include analysis of swing form, utilization of regular routines, diagnosis of individual problems, and on-course strategies of play. Different types of competition, special conditions, error shots and examine special condition play. Playing on the golf course, practicing driving, chipping, pitching, and/or putting green(s).
KIN116B.restrictions: A student may earn a maximum of 8 credits in all enrollments for this course if different activities or the same activities at higher levels are involved. Students are limited to a combined total of 8 credits in KIN 101-108 and KIN 111-118.

KIN116C.name: Horsemanship II
KIN116C.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KIN116C.restrictions: A student may earn a maximum of 8 credits in all enrollments for this course if different activities or the same activities at higher levels are involved. Students are limited to a combined total of 8 credits in KIN 101-108 and KIN 111-118.

KIN116S.name: Archery II
KIN116S.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
KIN116S.description: Advanced level hands-on learning of archery.
KIN116S.restrictions: A student may earn a maximum of 8 credits Students are limited to a combined total of 8 credits in KIN 101-108 and KIN 111-118 if different activities or the same activities at higher levels are involved.

KIN117B.name: Tennis II
KIN117B.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KIN117B.description: Development of intermediate and advanced strokes, footwork, and net play. Drills, strategy development, singles and doubles tournament, and psychological aspects of tennis.
KIN117B.restrictions: A student may earn a maximum of 8 credits in all enrollments for this course if different activities or the same activities at higher levels are involved. Students are limited to a combined total of 8 credits in KIN 101-108 and KIN 111-118.

KIN118A.name: Basketball II
KIN118A.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KIN118A.description: Enhance fundamental skills and develop advanced skills. Offensive and defensive strategies, and rules of the game.
KIN118A.restrictions: A student may earn a maximum of 8 credits in all enrollments for this course if different activities or the same activities at higher levels are involved. Students are limited to a combined total of 8 credits in KIN 101-108 and KIN 111-118.

KIN118B.name: Ice Hockey II
KIN118B.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KIN118B.description: Intermediate and advanced hockey concepts, skills and strategies. Puck control, physical conditioning, team system analysis, and drill design and implementation.
KIN118B.restrictions: A student may earn a maximum of 8 credits in all enrollments for this course if different activities or the same activities at higher levels are involved. Students are limited to a combined total of 8 credits in KIN 101-108 and KIN 111-118.

KIN118C.name: Soccer II
KIN118C.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KIN118C.description: Advanced soccer skills, drills, and matches. Game play, strategy development, and cardiovascular development.
KIN118C.restrictions: A student may earn a maximum of 8 credits in all enrollments for this course if different activities or the same activities at higher levels are involved. Students are limited to a combined total of 8 credits in KIN 101-108 and KIN 111-118.

KIN118E.name: Volleyball II
KIN118E.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KIN118E.description: Fundamental skill refinement and advanced skill learning. Offensive and defensive strategies, rules, and officiating.
KIN118E.restrictions: A student may earn a maximum of 8 credits in all enrollments for this course if different activities or the same activities at higher levels are involved. Students are limited to a combined total of 8 credits in KIN 101-108 and KIN 111-118.

KIN121.name: The Healthy Lifestyle
KIN121.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KIN121.description: Cardiovascular risk factors, lifestyle habits, and aerobic capacities and their relationship to optimal health and longevity. Individual physical activity required as part of the course.
KIN121.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Athletic Training Major or in the Health Promotion Minor or in the Kinesiology major.

KIN125.name: First Aid and Personal Safety
KIN125.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KIN125.description: Knowledge and application of first aid concepts relating to respiratory and cardiopulmonary disorders, shock, wounds, burns, fractures, drug poisoning, childbirth, litigation. Preventing trauma by recognizing and avoiding safety hazards.

KIN126.name: Introduction to Athletic Injury
KIN126.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
KIN126.description: Basic knowledge for the recognition and prevention of athletic injuries.
KIN126.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Kinesiology major.

KIN127.name: Taping and Bracing in Athletic Injury
KIN127.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
KIN127.description: Introduction to taping and bracing for athletic injuries.
KIN127.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Department of Kinesiology.

KIN171.name: Athletics in Higher Education
KIN171.description: Philosophy and organization of athletics. Athletics and academic achievement. Ethical issues, legal issues, social conduct, eligibility, athlete's rights and responsibilities.

KIN173.name: Foundations of Kinesiology
KIN173.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KIN173.description: Kinesiology as a disciplinary major. Subdisciplines and professions. Historical, professional and philosophical perspectives.
KIN173.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Athletic Training Major or in the Coaching Minor or in the Kinesiology major.

KIN202.name: Aerobic Exercise Instruction
KIN202.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
KIN202.description: Theory and practice for aerobic exercise leaders. Functional effects of physical activity. Safe exercise techniques. Modifications and precautions for special populations. Choreography practice. Health and exercise screening. Legal issues.

KIN204.name: Sailing and Cruising
KIN204.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KIN204.description: Knowledge, skills, and experience necessary to sail large vessels on inland and coastal waters. Live aboard and sail for six days and nights, traveling approximately 250 miles. Competence in sailing small crafts assumed.

KIN205.name: Lifeguarding
KIN205.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KIN205.description: Lifeguarding knowledge and skills necessary to obtain American Red Cross Lifeguarding certificate. Advanced swimming level is assumed.

KIN216.name: Applied Human Anatomy
KIN216.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KIN216.description: Structural anatomy of the human body. Interrelationships of structure, function, and human movement.
KIN216.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Athletic Training Major or in the Kinesiology major or in the Coaching Minor.

KIN217.name: Applied Human Anatomy Laboratory
KIN217.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
KIN217.description: Major bones, muscles, nerves, vessels, and organs of the human body. Articulations, muscle origins, muscle insertions, and prime moving actions.
KIN217.restrictions: Open to students in the Athletic Training major or in the Kinesiology major.

KIN227.name: Observations and Introduction to Clinical Skills in Athletic Training
KIN227.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
KIN227.description: Entry level knowledge and skills utilized by Athletic Training profession.
KIN227.prerequisite: (KIN 125 or concurrently) and (KIN 126 or concurrently) and (KIN 127 or concurrently)
KIN227.restrictions: Open to sophomores or juniors or seniors in the Department of Kinesiology.

KIN228.name: Clinical Rotation and Skills Introduction in Athletic Training
KIN228.description: Beginning progression of the basic hands-on clinical skills utilized by athletic trainers. Offered second half of semester.
KIN228.prerequisite: (KIN 125 or concurrently) or (KIN 126 or concurrently) or (KIN 127 or concurrently) or (KIN 320 or concurrently)
KIN228.restrictions: Open to students in the Athletic Training Major.

KIN250.name: Measurement in Kinesiology
KIN250.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KIN250.description: Methods and materials for measurement and evaluation. Motor skills, physical fitness, knowledge, and attitudes associated with physical activity.
KIN250.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Athletic Training Major or in the Kinesiology major.

KIN251.name: Principles of Human Movement
KIN251.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KIN251.description: Basic principles governing human movement with a focus on mechanics, movement coordination and motor learning aspects.
KIN251.restrictions: Open to students in the Athletic Training Major or in the Kinesiology major.

KIN300A.name: Coaching Baseball
KIN300A.description: Techniques for coaching baseball. Rules, strategies, and training. Development and evaluation of player skills. Planning, conducting, and evaluating practices.

KIN300C.name: Coaching Soccer
KIN300C.description: Techniques for coaching soccer. Developing and evaluating player and team skills. Planning, conducting and evaluating practices and games. Rules, drills, strategies and training.

KIN300D.name: Coaching Basketball
KIN300D.description: Techniques and strategies for coaching basketball. Rules, drills, and training. Development and evaluation of individual and team skills. Planning, conducting, and evaluating practices and games.

KIN300E.name: Coaching Football
KIN300E.description: Techniques and strategies for coaching football. Rules, drills, and training. Development and evaluation of individual and team skills. Planning, conducting, and evaluating practices and games.

KIN310.name: Physiological Bases of Physical Activity
KIN310.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
KIN310.description: Acute and chronic effects of exercise on various body systems. Principles of training, exercise prescription, and the role of physical activity in health and disease.
KIN310.prerequisite: {(PSL 431 and PSL 432) or (PSL 250 or PSL 310)} and (KIN 216 or ANTR 350) and (CEM 141 and KIN 173)
KIN310.restrictions: Open to students in the Athletic Training Major or in the Kinesiology major.

KIN320.name: Pathology of Sports Injury
KIN320.description: Pathophysiology and pathomechanics of sport injury, tissue response and the healing process as they relate to management and rehabilitation of sports injury.
KIN320.restrictions: Open to students in the Athletic Training Major or in the Kinesiology major.

KIN330.name: Biomechanics of Physical Activity
KIN330.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KIN330.description: Biomechanical analysis of human movement based upon musculoskeletal structure and function. Mechanical principles.
KIN330.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Athletic Training Major or in the Kinesiology major.

KIN345.name: Sport and Exercise Psychology (W)
KIN345.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KIN345.description: Psychological effects on sport, motor performance, and exercise behavior. Influence of sport and exercise on psychological development.
KIN345.prerequisite: (KIN 173) and completion of Tier I writing requirement
KIN345.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Athletic Training Major or in the Kinesiology major or in the Coaching Minor.

KIN355.name: Physical Activity and Health Education for Elementary Teachers
KIN355.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KIN355.description: Physical activity, health-related fitness, and motor skill development of children. Issues and research-based strategies in teaching physical activity and health education in elementary schools.
KIN355.restrictions: Open to sophomores or juniors or seniors in the Education major or in the Special Education-Learning Disabilities major or in the Child Development major.

KIN360.name: Physical Growth and Motor Behavior
KIN360.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
KIN360.description: Physical growth and biological maturity as related to motor performance and development. Sequential progressions of fundamental motor skills. Physical fitness of children and youth. Motor abilities. Stages of skill acquisition.
KIN360.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Athletic Training Major or in the Kinesiology major or in the Coaching Minor.

KIN365.name: Sensorimotor Control
KIN365.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
KIN365.description: Principles of sensorimotor control, coordination, and learning of human movement, from activities of daily living to the performance of elite athletes.
KIN365.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Athletic Training major or in the Kinesiology major.

KIN371.name: Introduction to Research Methods in Kinesiology
KIN371.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
KIN371.description: Research methods as they apply to Kinesiology, study design, statistics, elements of scientific process, scientific writing
KIN371.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Athletic Training Major or in the Kinesiology major.

KIN400.name: Principles of Coaching I
KIN400.description: Basic principles of anatomy, biomechanics, and physiology for coaching competitive sports. Applications to athletes of different ages and abilities.
KIN400.restrictions: Not open to freshmen or sophomores.

KIN401.name: Principles of Coaching II
KIN401.description: Sociological, administrative, philosophical, legal, ethical, and chemical health issues related to coaching competitive sports. Applications to athletes of different ages and abilities.
KIN401.restrictions: Not open to freshmen or sophomores.

KIN402.name: Coaching for Strength, Conditioning and Fitness
KIN402.description: Basic and advanced theoretical and practical principles of coaching/training for increased fitness and/or sports performance. Individual applications to diverse populations.

KIN411.name: Laboratory Experiences in Exercise Physiology
KIN411.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
KIN411.description: Laboratory techniques for testing and evaluating individuals for aerobic fitness, muscular strength and endurance, body composition and other physiologic responses to exercise. Exercise program development for personal health fitness.
KIN411.restrictions: Open to seniors in the Athletic Training major or in the Kinesiology major.

KIN421.name: Lower Body Injury Evaluation
KIN421.description: Knowledge and skills needed for evaluating lower body injuries in athletic training. Techniques and tests used for evaluating acute and chronic injuries to the lower body.
KIN421.restrictions: Open to students in the Athletic Training Major.

KIN422.name: Rehabilitation of Athletic Injuries
KIN422.description: Rehabilitation techniques to manage athletic injuries. Anatomical and neurophysiological bases of techniques. Indications and contraindications of rehabilitation protocols.
KIN422.restrictions: Open to students in the Athletic Training Major.

KIN423.name: Therapeutic Modalities
KIN423.description: Therapeutic modalities used to manage athletic injuries and their indications and contraindications. Rationale for and techniques of using thermal and electrical modalities for athletic injuries.
KIN423.restrictions: Open to students in the Athletic Training major.

KIN424.name: Psychology of Injury
KIN424.description: Psychological aspects of athletic injuries. Sociocultural, mental, emotional, and physical behaviors of patients involved in injury rehabilitation.

KIN425.name: Organization and Administration of Athletic Training
KIN425.description: Knowledge and skills necessary for the administration of an athletic training program. Ethics, policies, procedures, insurance, liability, budgets, facilities, and record-keeping in athletic training.
KIN425.restrictions: Open to students in the Athletic Training Major.

KIN426.name: Upper Body Injury Evaluation
KIN426.description: Knowledge and skills needed for evaluating upper extremity injuries in athletic training. Techniques and tests for evaluating acute and chronic injuries to the upper body.
KIN426.restrictions: Open to students in the Athletic Training Major.

KIN427.name: Clinical Rotations in Athletic Training
KIN427.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
KIN427.description: Knowledge and skills used to manage, evaluate, and rehabilitate orthopedic injuries in various clinical settings including colleges, high schools, and rehabilitation clinics.
KIN427.prerequisite: KIN 125 and KIN 126 and KIN 127 and KIN 227 and KIN 320
KIN427.restrictions: Open to students in the Athletic Training major.

KIN443.name: Psychophysiological Aspects of Kinesiology
KIN443.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
KIN443.description: Interaction between psychological processes and physiological parameters in exercise science. Utilization of psychophysiological techniques for assessing psychological consequences of exercise and physical activity engagement.
KIN443.restrictions: Not open to freshmen or sophomores.

KIN445.name: Sport and Physical Activity in Society (W)
KIN445.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
KIN445.description: Sociocultural context of and social practices in sport and physical activity.
KIN445.prerequisite: (KIN 173) and completion of Tier I writing requirement
KIN445.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Athletic Training Major or in the Kinesiology major and open to graduate students in the Department of Kinesiology.

KIN454.name: Facility Planning and Construction
KIN454.description: Planning of athletic and physical education facilities such as gymnasia, ice rinks, swimming pools, and outdoor areas. Space utilization standards and guidelines. Selection of materials and equipment.
KIN454.restrictions: Not open to freshmen or sophomores.

KIN456.name: Ethical Issues in Athletics
KIN456.description: Ethics of sports at the institutional level in contemporary society. Political, social, and commercial pressures.
KIN456.restrictions: Not open to freshmen or sophomores.

KIN457.name: Sports and Cardiovascular Nutrition
KIN457.description: Nutrition for optimizing sport training, recovery, and performance; power, intermittent, and endurance sports. Role of nutrition, physical activity and exercise on cardiovascular and overall health.
KIN457.prerequisite: (HNF 150) and (PSL 250 or PSL 310 or PSL 431) and (BMB 200 or BMB 401 or BMB 461 or KIN 310)

KIN465.name: Adapted Physical Activity
KIN465.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
KIN465.description: Teaching and coaching physical activities for persons with disabilities.
KIN465.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Athletic Training Major or in the Kinesiology major.

KIN490.name: Independent Study
KIN490.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KIN490.description: Supervised individual or group study in various fields of emphasis in kinesiology.

KIN491.name: Special Topics in Kinesiology
KIN491.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KIN491.restrictions: Not open to freshmen or sophomores.

KIN492.name: Internship: Non-Physiologically Based
KIN492.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KIN492.description: Professional internship in kinesiology under faculty supervision. Students are involved in community and corporate internships not including physiological testing of patients/clients.
KIN492.restrictions: Open to seniors in the Kinesiology major. Approval of department.

KIN493.name: Internship: Physiologically Based
KIN493.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KIN493.description: Professional internship in kinesiology under faculty supervision. Students are involved in clinical, rehabilitation, and corporate programs.
KIN493.restrictions: Open to seniors in the Kinesiology major. Approval of department.

KIN494.name: Fieldwork
KIN494.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KIN494.description: Supervised practice in teaching physical education activities, coaching sports, administering sports programs, or conducting research or service activities in kinesiology.

KIN495.name: Undergraduate Experiences in Research
KIN495.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KIN495.description: Supervised experiences in research in various fields of emphasis in kinesiology.

KIN496.name: Internship: Athletic Training-Based
KIN496.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
KIN496.description: Professional internship in Athletic Training under faculty supervision. Observation and prevention of athletic injury in high school and collegiate athletes.
KIN496.restrictions: Open to seniors in the Department of Kinesiology. Approval of department.

KIN800.name: Pathophysiology and Functional Anatomy
KIN800.description: Functional anatomy and pathophysiology of sports injury. Practical strategies and methods for management, development, and advancement of sport professionals, athletes, and stakeholders.

KIN801.name: Emergency Procedures for Athletic Trainers
KIN801.description: Scientific and philosophical foundations of preventative care and pre-hospital emergency care. Knowledge, critical thinking, problem solving skills, emergency care principles and associated skills in a variety of clinical and professional settings.

KIN802.name: Athletic Training Practicum I
KIN802.description: Integration of learning with the associated psychomotor skills required for the practice of athletic training. Implementation of emergency action plans, preventative measures, emergency trauma, and record keeping practices in a clinical field experience under the direct supervision of a preceptor.

KIN803.name: Athletic Training Practicum II
KIN803.description: Practicum experiences to integrate learning with the associated psychomotor skills. Anatomical palpations, emergency procedures, and clinical practices.

KIN804.name: Athletic Training Practicum III
KIN804.description: Clinical practicum experiences for learning psychomotor skills related to Athletic Training. Lower extremity injuries, lower extremity modalities and rehabilitation, and clinical practices in a clinical field experience.

KIN805.name: Athletic Training Practicum IV
KIN805.description: Clinical practicum experiences to integrate learning with the associated psychomotor skills. Emphasizes general medical conditions and clinical practices in a clinical field experience.

KIN806.name: Athletic Training Practicum V
KIN806.description: Clinical practicum experiences in learning with the associated psychomotor skills required for athletic training. Upper extremity injuries, upper extremity modalities and rehabilitation, general medical conditions, pharmacology, and clinical practices.

KIN807.name: Athletic Training Practicum VI
KIN807.description: Clinical practicum experiences for learning with the associated psychomotor skills required for the practice of athletic training. Immersive clinical field experience under the direct supervision of a preceptor.
KIN807.prerequisite: KIN 806 and KIN 883 and KIN 884 and KIN 885

KIN810.name: Metabolic Responses to Exercise
KIN810.description: Acute and chronic effects of exercise on metabolic processes. Role of these processes in limiting exercise performance.

KIN811.name: Physiological Evaluation and Exercise Prescription
KIN811.description: Techniques in evaluation of physiological capacity and in exercise prescription for various populations.

KIN812.name: Cardiorespiratory Responses to Exercise
KIN812.description: Acute and chronic effects of exercise on cardiovascular and respiratory system functions. Role of these systems in limiting exercise performance.

KIN813.name: Neuromuscular Responses to Exercise
KIN813.description: Acute and chronic effects of exercise on neuromuscular functions. Role of these systems in limiting exercise performance.

KIN815.name: Essentials of Strength and Conditioning
KIN815.description: Methods and techniques associated with design of strength and conditioning programs to enhance performance in sport and fitness.
KIN815.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Department of Kinesiology.

KIN816.name: Exercise Physiology Across the Lifespan
KIN816.description: Exercise physiology from childhood, through older adulthood, including pregnancy.

KIN820.name: Advanced Clinical Evaluation
KIN820.description: Identification of structural pathologies. Principles and techniques applied during manual evaluation of structural pathology.

KIN822.name: Rehabilitation Techniques for Musculoskeletal Dysfunction
KIN822.description: Techniques used to rehabilitate musculoskeletal dysfunctions. Skills to enhance neuromuscular function such as proprioceptive neuromuscular facilitation (PNF) and muscle-firing pattern techniques.

KIN825.name: Injury Control in Sports and Physical Activity
KIN825.description: Principles of epidemiology to identify and analyze risk of injury in physical activities. Skills for decision-making in injury prevention programs.

KIN829.name: Safety and Injury Control
KIN829.description: Health and safety of participants. Prevention, care, and management of injuries.
KIN829.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Education Major or in the Sport Coaching and Leadership Major or in the Sport Coaching and Leadership Graduate Certificate.

KIN832.name: Lower Body Physical Assessment
KIN832.description: Principles of lower body physical assessment. Mechanisms of injury, the evaluation process, and testing leading to diagnosis of lower body injuries.

KIN833.name: Lower Body Therapeutic Interventions
KIN833.description: Development, implementation, and evaluation of treatment plans. Therapeutic modalities and rehabilitation interventions for treating lower body injuries and general health conditions. Evidence-based approaches to therapeutic interventions.

KIN834.name: Evidence Based Practice in Athletic Training
KIN834.description: Methods for critically evaluating the quality of clinical research, implanting outcomes assessment techniques, and developing interventions to improve the delivery of primary healthcare in athletic training practice.

KIN835.name: Pharmacology for Athletic Trainers
KIN835.description: Application of pharmacology to Athletic Training clinical practice. Drug-related side effects when a negative reaction is occurring, and managing instances of drug abuse in athletes.

KIN836.name: Upper Body Physical Assessment
KIN836.description: Principles of upper body physical assessment. Mechanisms of injury, the evaluation process, and testing leading to diagnosis of upper body injuries.

KIN837.name: Upper Body Therapeutic Interventions
KIN837.description: Evidence-based approach to development, implementation, and evaluation. Treatment plans using therapeutic modalities and rehabilitation interventions in the treatment of upper body injuries and general medical conditions.

KIN838.name: General Medical Conditions for Athletic Trainers
KIN838.description: General medical conditions from the athletic training perspective. Diagnosis and treatment of patients in daily clinical practice.

KIN840.name: Psychosocial Aspects of Physical Activity
KIN840.description: Social psychology of sport and physical activity.

KIN849.name: Theory and Practice of Modern Sport Leadership
KIN849.description: Theories of management and organizational behavior in a sport context. Practical strategies and methods for management, development, and advancement of sport professionals, athletes, and stakeholders.
KIN849.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Sport Coaching and Leadership Graduate Certificate or in the Sport Coaching and Leadership Major or approval of department.

KIN850.name: Special Topics in Sport Coaching and Leadership
KIN850.description: Issues in sport coaching and leadership.
KIN850.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Sport Coaching and Leadership Graduate Certificate or in the Sport Coaching and Leadership Major or approval of department.

KIN852.name: Ethics in Sport Coaching and Leadership
KIN852.semester: Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KIN852.description: Ethical decision-making processes and moral obligations of the sport coach and leaders.
KIN852.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Sport Coaching and Leadership Graduate Certificate or in the Sport Coaching and Leadership Major or approval of department.

KIN853.name: Athletic Administration in Higher Education
KIN853.description: Administrative theory, structure, and budget. Facilities, equipment, and marketing. Legal, medical, and safety aspects.

KIN854.name: Legal and Administrative Issues for Administrators and Coaches
KIN854.description: Responsibilities of administrators, directors of recreational programs and athletic coaches for providing and maintaining educationally sound athletic programs for amateur athletes. Concepts, policies and procedures that enhance the physical and psychological health of amateur athletes. Obligations for managing the risks of participation in physical activities.
KIN854.restrictions: Open to students in the Education Major or in the Sport Coaching and Leadership Graduate Certificate or in the Sport Coaching and Leadership Major.

KIN855.name: Psychosocial Bases of Coaching Athletes
KIN855.description: Athlete motivation, motivational climates, and the social psychology of coaching and leadership. Communication skills and leadership behaviors. Mental skills that enhance an athlete’s performance.
KIN855.restrictions: Open to students in the Education Major or in the Sport Coaching and Leadership Graduate Certificate or in the Sport Coaching and Leadership Major or approval of department.

KIN856.name: Physical Bases of Coaching Athletes
KIN856.description: Principles of anatomy, biomechanics, and physiology for coaching amateur athletes in various sports. Relationships between the biological bases of coaching and physical conditioning, and performance enhancement.
KIN856.restrictions: Open to students in the Education Major or in the Sport Coaching and Leadership Graduate Certificate or in the Sport Coaching and Leadership Major.

KIN857.name: Promoting Positive Youth Development Through Sport
KIN857.description: Educational athletic programs for youth. Positive youth development through sports. Coaching and mentoring.
KIN857.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Education Major or in the Sport Coaching and Leadership Major or in the Sport Coaching and Leadership Graduate Certificate.

KIN858.name: Student-Athlete Development
KIN858.description: Historical and contemporary issues faced by student-athletes, competencies required for student-athlete eligibility, student-athlete retention data metrics, and reflective thought and programming for student-athletes.

KIN859.name: Scholastic Athletic Administration
KIN859.description: Skills to direct athletic programs in secondary educational settings. Athletic policies and guidelines of facilities, equipment, budget, and structure.
KIN859.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Sport Coaching and Leadership Graduate Certificate or in the Sport Coaching and Leadership Major or approval of department.

KIN860.name: Growth and Motor Behavior
KIN860.description: Developmental skill sequences and behavior across the lifespan. Correlates of growth, maturation, and motor behavior. Individual and gender differences.

KIN861.name: Growth, Maturation, and Physical Activity
KIN861.description: Physical growth, biological maturation, and motor performance. Development of tissues and organs. Development of motor components. Influences of gender and age on growth and performance. Methods of assessment.

KIN862.name: Neural Basis of Human Movement
KIN862.description: Neural basis of sensorimotor control, investigating cortical and subcortical structure/function relationships in healthy humans, and in individuals with movement disorders.

KIN865.name: Stages of Athlete Development
KIN865.description: Developmental analyses of stages of athletes. Early childhood through early adulthood. Motor skill, biological maturation, and physical growth issues.
KIN865.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Education Major or in the Sport Coaching and Leadership Major or in the Sport Coaching and Leadership Graduate Certificate.

KIN868.name: Skill Development in Athletes
KIN868.description: Best practices in developing skills. Age appropriate approaches. Maximizing abilities of individuals and team success. Scouting methods and competitive sport approaches.
KIN868.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Education Major or in the Sport Coaching and Leadership Major or in the Sport Coaching and Leadership Graduate Certificate.

KIN870.name: Physical Activity and Well-Being
KIN870.description: Relationship of physical activity to human well-being. Influence of growth, biological maturity, aging, body composition, nutrition, training, and rest on health and performance.
KIN870.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Kinesiology.

KIN871.name: Research Methods in Kinesiology
KIN871.description: Experimental, longitudinal, survey, and qualitative research methods in kinesiology. Writing research proposals and reports. Research ethics.
KIN871.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Kinesiology.

KIN872.name: Coaching Science: Applied Research
KIN872.description: Coaching, sport leadership, science and best practices. Applied research and inquiry.
KIN872.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Sport Coaching and Leadership Major.

KIN880.name: Sport and Leadership Practicum
KIN880.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KIN880.description: Supervised practical experiences in specific sport or leadership programs.
KIN880.prerequisite: (KIN 872 and KIN 856) and ((KIN 855 or concurrently) or (KIN 857 or concurrently))
KIN880.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Sport Coaching and Leadership Major.

KIN883.name: Health Care Administration for Athletic Trainers
KIN883.description: Professional management and administrative issues in athletic training. Planning, design, development, organization, implementation, direction, and evaluation of health care programs. Current issues in athletic training related to professional conduct and practice.
KIN883.prerequisite: KIN 835 and KIN 836 and KIN 837 and KIN 838

KIN884.name: Spine Evaluations and Advanced Rehabilitation
KIN884.description: Techniques of manual clinical evaluation of the spine. Correction skills for spinal dysfunctions.

KIN885.name: Sport Biomechanics
KIN885.description: Biomechanics of tissues involved in common musculoskeletal injuries. Common methods of biomechanical assessment in athletic populations, and application of these concepts to the mechanisms of musculoskeletal injury and the approach to rehabilitation.

KIN886.name: Psychology of Sports Injury and Rehabilitation
KIN886.description: Psychology of injury that may affect athletes. Risk, culture, pain science, adherence to rehabilitation regimens, the relationship between psychological factors and clinical outcomes, and referrals for additional support.

KIN887.name: Performance Enhancement in Sport
KIN887.description: Athletic trainer's roles in modifying nutritional behaviors of athletes. Achieving peak performance in athletes by training and consumption of nutrients. Pre-game and post-game meals.

KIN888.name: Seminar in Athletic Training
KIN888.description: Scientific writing and clinical research. Case reports, critically appraised topics (CATs), or research projects to address health-related problems in Athletic Training.

KIN890.name: Independent Study in Kinesiology
KIN890.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KIN890.description: Individual study in an area of kinesiology under faculty supervision.
KIN890.restrictions: Open only to master's students. Approval of department.

KIN893.name: Internship in Kinesiology
KIN893.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KIN893.description: Supervised internship in sports medicine, athletic administration, coaching, or education agencies. Capstone experience option in master's degree program.
KIN893.restrictions: Open only to graduate students in the Department of Kinesiology.

KIN894.name: Field Experiences in Kinesiology
KIN894.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KIN894.description: Supervised graduate practicum in schools or other settings.

KIN895.name: Research Ethics
KIN895.description: Identifying and resolving ethical problems in research. Collegial interactions. Authorship, publication, and reviewing practices. Data management. Ownership of data and intellectual property. Conflicts of interest. Protection of human and animal subjects. Lab safety and compliance.

KIN896.name: Integrative Capstone in Sport Coaching and Leadership
KIN896.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KIN896.description: Integrative capstone in coaching science, best practices, leadership, and management in sport.
KIN896.prerequisite: KIN 872 and KIN 880 or approval of department
KIN896.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Sport Coaching and Leadership Major.

KIN897.name: Project in Kinesiology
KIN897.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KIN897.description: Project experience under the guidance and supervision of MSU faculty. Development of products such as technical reports, instructional media, or curriculum materials to address an educationally significant problem. Capstone experience option in master's degree program.
KIN897.restrictions: Open only to master's students in the Department of Kinesiology.

KIN899.name: Master's Thesis Research
KIN899.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KIN899.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Kinesiology.

KIN940.name: Issues in Psychosocial Aspects of Physical Activity
KIN940.description: Selected issues in the psychology and sociology of sport and physical activity.

KIN941.name: Motivational Processes in Sport and Exercise
KIN941.description: Motivational processes in sport and exercise settings. Antecedents and consequences of motivated behavior from theoretical, research, and application perspectives. Participation motivation in sport, intrinsic/extrinsic motivational orientations, achievement goals, and contemporary theories of exercise motivation.
KIN941.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Kinesiology or approval of department.

KIN960.name: Issues in Motor Behavior
KIN960.description: Selected issues in motor development, motor learning, adapted physical education, and related fields of study.

KIN990.name: Independent Study in Kinesiology
KIN990.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KIN990.description: Individual study in an area of kinesiology under faculty supervision.
KIN990.restrictions: Open only to doctoral students. Approval of department.

KIN995.name: Research Practicum in Kinesiology
KIN995.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KIN995.description: Supervised research practicum. Design, execution, analysis, presentation, critique, and revision of research projects.
KIN995.restrictions: Open only to doctoral students in the College of Education. Approval of department.
